paragraphs.text:
%spark.dep
z.reset() // clean up previously added artifact and repository
z.load("com.amazonaws:aws-java-sdk:1.7.4")
z.load("org.apache.hadoop:hadoop-aws:2.7.1")
z.fetch().size()

paragraphs.title: Load the data and manipulate the data (drop invalid lines, create the DF)
paragraphs.text:
%spark

// load the csv into a Data Frame
val incidentsDF = spark.read
         .format("csv")
         .option("header", "true") //reading the headers
         .option("mode", "DROPMALFORMED") // drops the malformed lines
         .load("s3a://lp-deps-test/data/Police_Department_Incidents.csv")

// check the number of rows
incidentsDF.count

msg.data:
incidentsDF: org.apache.spark.sql.DataFrame = [IncidntNum: string, Category: string ... 11 more fields]
res5: Long = 2138115

paragraphs.title: Set up a map for displaying results on it (leaflet.js)

paragraphs.title: Display the latest 100 incidents (Spark DF api)
Display the first 100 incidents for a given category (Spark SQL)
paragraphs.text:
%spark

// register the data as a temp table
incidentsDF.registerTempTable("incidents")

val sqlDF = spark.sql("SELECT IncidntNum, Category, X, Y FROM incidents")
z.angularBind("locations", sqlDF.head(100)) // this is what sends the data to the frontend
